page.title: 07FARMING AROUND AYLMERTON
page.content: Farming in the area can be described as{arable with livestock. }Outwardly, the impression is one of arable, as most of the farmland is cropped, the main exception being Felbrigg Park. The main arable crops are{wheat, {barley}and{sugar-beet,}with a range of other crops, including lettuces, grown occasionally. Closer inspection of the farms shows that considerable numbers of livestock are also kept. Hall Farm, Felbrigg, grazes{beef cattle}on the parkland at Felbrigg Hall, and Park Wall Farm also has cattle. Several farms, including Church Farm and Laurel Farm, keep{pigs and other livestock in the farm buildings. The crops grown can be used for{pig or{cattle food}- for example, kale and barley. Sugar-beet tops are also used, and beet pulp from the factory.
